website_summaries.verdict: Soft, scent-free, and flushable litter has fast become a customer favorite.
pros: Litter is lightweight and soft on cat’s paws
Produces solid clumps and little-to-no dust
Actively combats strong litter box odor
Natural litter is safe to flush
Comes in a convenient, resealable bag
cons: Clumps take a while to fully harden
Don't scoop too soon or they will crumble

customer_reviews.title: Great flushable litter at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent choice for litter boxes in smaller living spaces. I live in an open floor plan apartment, so there's no where to go to escape the smell of used cat litter sitting in a trash can. sWheat Scoop not only works well as a multi-cat litter (good clumping and odor reduction), but it's completely flushable, so the problem of lingering soiled litter smell is greatly reduced.
customer_reviews.author: Mike DelisiTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Choose another litter for multiple cats.
customer_reviews.text: Another fail from Swheat Scoop. This one like the other has a "burned" smell after enough urine comes in contact with it. There is no way to scoop it out, just total replacement that is not cost effective at all. It did not seem to clump good either, not sure what the problem was but we switched to Precious Cat Ultra Premium. I did try to contact Swheat Scoop to find out if there was something we could do to make this better but they did not answer when I called and did not return a phone call afterwards, not good customer service!
customer_reviews.author: C. R.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, absorbs great
customer_reviews.text: Have been using sWheatscoop for a long time. Faithful customer here. Works great, absorbs great, controls odor great! If you are a cat owner, you know that it doesn't matter the litter, it will get tracked to some degree, but that comes with the territory. My only complaint is that it does create dust when I clean the litterbox. I keep the littlerbox in my craft room, and anything very close to the box needs to be dusted often. Still, this is my preferred litter for my cats. I like it much, much better than clay....
customer_reviews.author: Jacki

customer_reviews.title: love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: love this stuff, it clumps well, flushes down septic systems. We use it to toilet train kittens..no smell and flushes well
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Stanke

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Scoops easily and is biodegradable..
customer_reviews.text: My cousin loves this litter and kept telling me to try it. I didn't want to spend the extra money so she surprised me with a bag to try. I'm hooked and will never by another litter. It ends up being cheaper than the clay litters because it last much longer. I clean my litter box daily and there is never a bad odor until they poop which I smell immediately and scoop it out. I love the fact that it is biodegradable.
customer_reviews.author: Sharan

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is not clay.I have a long haired who got extremely matted from clay type dust.No formaldehyde fumes like wood products no chemical stink like scented litter. Not much odor control, messy as they all are when kitty leaves the box but it all stays in the bathroom and doesn't smear. I use liners,easy clean up.I also scoop the poop into the toilet right away...cuz, well, it still smells like poop of course. Nothing gonna change that.
customer_reviews.author: Only P. Nephastus

customer_reviews.title: Sadly Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this cat liter. So tired of dusty clay liter I am on a mission to find an environmentally friendly alternative that controls both odor and is easily scooped. This liter is okay at controlling the smell but it does not clump as well and goes everywhere when my cats exit their box. I would happily sweep more and keep using it but the lack of clumping makes it hard to really scoop the box clean so I gave up and changed the liter a few times already this week. This is not a a sustainable method when one is on a budget. The search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon George

customer_reviews.title: Healthy & non toxic litter - Thank you ~
customer_reviews.text: My local grocer does not carry the wheat based litter - just all the same junk with fragrances & crap that can make cats sick .... and perhaps people too. I have let cat owners know of the dangers of most of the litter on the market & one owner thanked me recently as her cat was constantly squinting & looked odd - which her vet couldn't figure out either. But it's just common sense. Just be careful to never set the litter outside as it can attract mice, squirrels or raccoons - as it is a food source - wheat.
customer_reviews.author: BolBol

customer_reviews.title: Eco friendly, but there are better options out there.
customer_reviews.text: Preface: I own a Litter Robot v2. I bought this as I was looking for an eco friendly cat litter that would work well with my litter robot. I had previously used World's Best Cat Litter which is what I ended up going back to. The scent on sWheat is neutral. Personally I wasn't looking for anything that was heavily perfumed so this was fine. In comparison to World's Best I found that sWheat generated a lot more dust and was less absorbent. I don't think that World's Best is perfect but I am glad to be going back to it after my experience with sWheat.
customer_reviews.author: N Makar

customer_reviews.title: It’s safe to eat! LOL
customer_reviews.text: We looked for an “edible” cat litter because our dog continually gets into the litter box to eat poop out of it and she wound up getting a horrible infection from the normal sandy cat litter people usually buy. Who knew cat litter could cost us 1600 bucks??!? Well the package for this litter said It was edible and although we heavily discourage it, our dog does safely indulge when our backs our turned. It also keeps our cats’ paws from getting dusty or dirty unlike our old cat litter. It could be easier to clean up but I don’t care.
customer_reviews.author: banana bear

customer_reviews.title: Go for Premium version if you have multiple cats
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 indoor cats and typically buy the Shweat Scoops Premium. I got the Multicat just to try it again (it's what I used before they came out with premium version and I thought I would go back and compare). I found that it got smelly and needed replacing more quickly than the premium version. so even tho Premium is sometimes more expensive, it is less in the long run as you don't have to replace it as often. I go through the 40 lb bag of Premium in about 4 weeks, but this only lasted 3.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff, except...
customer_reviews.text: This litter is great, I loved it. It's low dust, controls odor, clumps well, is easy to clean, and it's natural and biodegradable. Unfortunately, one of my cats is very mouthy, everything goes in her mouth, not everything comes out. This litter didn't...she decided it was tasty, or she likes the texture or who knows what she's thinking, but she started eating it and I'm not comfortable with it, so I can't use it any more. If you have a "normal" cat that just does his/her business in the box and moves on, you should definitely try it.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Glad I switched
customer_reviews.text: I used to use the crystal litter because it worked so well! Until I heard about how bad it was for my kitty and the environment so I looked for an alternative. Well I was surprised at how quickly the "litter box" scent kicked in. I invested in a good natural litter deodorizer and it worked! The clumping works great also. This litter does take a little more responsibility but for me it's worth it! I've gotten this bag twice already and am sticking to it 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: CoryDane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Totally worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. If I have to have a cat litter box for a cat who hates going outside, might as well use something that flushes easily and traps the smell. It clumps better than the blue colored bag but doesn't clog the toilet. I won't go back to litter that needs to go into a trash can and stink! I clean the box twice a day, since it's in the bathroom that I use before and after work, but it could go days without being scooped. A bag lasts a month. I keep ours 5-6" deep.
customer_reviews.author: Rubber Ducky

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: No dust, which is great. No smell when you change and add more. I have two cats who use the box so I scoop it every other day. I do notice a weird smell when it gets wet (from pee) it's not too bad as long as I change it every 2 days. I have the box inside a hidden kitty box furniture piece and the smell gets out a bit but I also live in a small place. I was thinking of maybe mixing it with a bit of the clay kitty litter just to soak up the smell which I saw some people did that. Still glad to have switched from regular litter
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: ... Petsmart and found it cheaper on Amazon I absolutely love it! It's easy to scoop up
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this natural litter from Petsmart and found it cheaper on Amazon I absolutely love it! It's easy to scoop up, clumps great, and cats are happy with it! It doesn't smell and because it's natural, you don't have to worry about your kitties walking in it and then licking chemicals off of their feet later and getting slowly poisoned daily. We really do need to think about how things affect our cats, not only in their food they eat but the litter they step in, because they clean their feet so whatever is on it is what they ingest! Will continue to by this brand and keep my kitties safe and free from toxic substances!
customer_reviews.author: Catt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent litter, lightweight, no dust
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else, I've tried many, many litters. This is a great combo of no scent, lightweight, no dust and minimal tracking. The price here for 25 lbs is way less than I see at regular pet stores. Of course, the delivery person has to huff and puff carrying it from the van, up the stairs to the house. Sorry, sorry. We have 3 old cats and 2 large litter boxes (one on each floor of the house) that I can at 1-2/day.
customer_reviews.author: D. Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy again!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is HORRIBLE! 1. It smells much worse than "First Step" (which I will use again, once this is finished). Really quite nauseating. It was advertised as sweet smelling. 2. It clumps so badly than I need another person to help scrape out the urine clumps -- which are like cement.
customer_reviews.author: Anna1953

customer_reviews.title: Wood floors and cats. And allergies.
customer_reviews.text: Unscented. Clumps extremely well - needs a liner or you must toss the box as well. Does not scratch my wood floor. Easier on bare feet. Not so dangerous for the occasional dog that is attracted to the box, (not that MY dog would ever do such a thing ...more than a few times a day....) The cats use it. Other litters...not so much, hence the new couch. Hmph. Having the sWheatScoop delivered to the house is another plus. I use a large garbage bag to line the box then turn it over on itself on trash day to start again with a clean box.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Great transition from clay-based litter!
customer_reviews.text: This litter truly is incredible and much better for our cats as well as the environment. One of our cats likes to party in the litter box and kick it all over. We no longer have litter spread throughout our carpet and hardwood floors! It doesn’t track to their paws and still performs very well. Urine doesn’t clump the same as clay, it goes to the bottom of the litter box so it’s covered up even more and reduces the smell. I haven’t and won’t ever flush it, but with biodegradable bags I feel we have made a greater step toward leaving a lesser environmental footprint. We will keep ordering for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Kraken

customer_reviews.title: Packaging Issue...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered this before and love that it’s biodegradable. It doesn’t capture scent as well as the non natural ones but it’s worth it. The packaging of this is what I wasn’t happy about this time around. The litter bag was split open. Thankfully only a little had come out but we could have had a massive mess on our hands. It was cut by the side fold so no way it was us opening it!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Jones

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Clump Well and Difficult to Scoop
customer_reviews.text: This litter doesn't clump hardly at all. So when you scoop it out, the clumps largely fall apart. Overtime, you get a lot of litter that has dried out and reeks of urine. So you're left with two options: totally dump out a lot of expensive litter or let your house stink. It is also larger than clay-based litter and takes forever to scoop out. Less of a dust problem than clay, but more of a tracking problem. Good idea, but this is not in anyway a good substitute for clay-based litter.
customer_reviews.author: MarvinTheMartian

customer_reviews.title: The only kitty litter that doesn't stick inside my cat's paws.
customer_reviews.text: It has below average clumping capacity, and an unobtrusive scent. It is not sticky at all, though, for my baby's feet, and she's much happier not having hard lumps stuck between her toes. Does track, but no dust. All kitty litters are not equal, but this one is a gem for this particular cat. I do not use it for my other seven rescues. I wouldn't flush into a septic system, either.
customer_reviews.author: nobsratings

customer_reviews.title: The best choice for your cats and the environment.
customer_reviews.text: I always use Sweepscoop for my cat's litter pan. It's easily biodegradable and easy to scoop.Also, I am able to recycle the plastic bag that it came it. So nothing goes to the land fill.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia A. Sciore

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't clump urine properly
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what these people were talking about, urine doesn't clump tightly at all with this litter, it stays gooey and sticks to the bottom of the pan, and while trying to find and unstick the clump, you end up cutting it in half, or it ends up sticking to your scoop. It's a disaster. The clumps are a weird lumpy mess as well so you can't scoop them properly. Yes, there's a bit less smell, but what's the point if I have to fight to clean this thing every day. I'll stick to World's Best Cat Litter, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Macky

customer_reviews.title: Great litter, healthier for your pet!
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a huge bag. So happy this was delivered to my door so I don’t have to lug it around. As for the product, it works well and I don’t have to worry as much about dust and it’s better for my cat. It doesn’t track as much as clay litter and smells far better. Doesn’t clump quite as good, but still clumps and I’d buy this over clay litter any day. Also way better than the worlds best cat litter, which smells terrible. This is quite neutral.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve W

customer_reviews.title: The best cat litter ever.
customer_reviews.text: This cat litter is the best I've ever used. I've had cats on and off for over 40 years, so that statement means something. It controls the odors, absolutely. It is super absorbent. I live in the country, so biodegradable is important to me. Unlike clay litters, this breaks-down easily allowing me to discard waste in environmentally friendly way. (I bury mine, like I said country living)
customer_reviews.author: GrammaWolfe

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Litter Ever!
customer_reviews.text: My husband & my Sphynx kitten both have allergies to any regular kitty litter, I've even tried the top notch "dust free" (which it still wasn't completely dust free) & several "chrystal" type litters.... nothing compares to this dustless, odorless, natural kitty litter. Both my husband, my kitty & myself are 100% happy with this litter! It was delivered quickly on May 24th & here it is July 10th & I still have plenty for multiple box changes! .... now if I could just figure out how to get my cat to cover her poo...
customer_reviews.author: MsTøxiic

customer_reviews.title: Great Litter!  Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I just switched from Tidy Cats LIghtweight litter to this based on other Amazon customer reviews. I love it! First of all, my two cats are very picky when I change litter, but they were fine with sWheat scoop right away. It is healthier for them, controls odor very well and also clumps well. It does not track around my house nearly as much as the Tidy Cats I was using, so that is one of the biggest pluses for me as I was having to vacuum my carpets 2-3 times per day with Tidy Cats, which is insane! And, sWheat scoop is a great value, so I am saving money and it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Rieser

customer_reviews.title: Not What It Once Was
customer_reviews.text: I began using this for a cat with allergies and was pleased with it until the last few orders. It has become too dusty and therefore, no longer good for cats with allergies and sensitivities to dust!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Biodegradable, but doesn't cover the smell that well.
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this is biodegradable and there's nothing in it that could be harmful to me or my cat, however compared to other litters it does not cover the smell all that well. I like the price and like that it can be bought in a large size, but I may just go back to the walnut shells that I've used for reptiles as well. That seems to cover the smell better.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, unscented, quality litter.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite litter. I originally bought it because it was lightweight and it was easy to get into my shopping cart. After trying it, even though my local store no longer carries it, I continue to use it. Buying the bag from Amazon makes it very easy for me. It is delivered to my door so I don’t have to drag it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: It's flushable!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I am actually able to let the soiled litter sit in the toilet for an hour and then simply flush it down the toilet. It is after-all just wheat and not clay. Talking about clay, my last cat died from lung cancer. I didn't even knew that she smoked! Turns out clay litter can contain silicon. Breathing in silicon can cause silicosis in mammals (yes cats and humans are mammals) and silicosis can lead to lung cancer. Hmmm, I wonder if there is a connection here? So I refuse in taking a chance and possibly exposing my cat to silicon inhalation.
customer_reviews.author: tfmd

customer_reviews.title: Best litter around
customer_reviews.text: I have tried them all and Swheat Scoop works the best for odor control, dust, etc. One of my cats is allergic to scented litter. He was having terrible breathing difficulty at times, until we discovered why. He and his sister really like this litter. I do to and very much like that it is much lighter than the clay litters.
customer_reviews.author: Cerulean Artist

customer_reviews.title: Not as much dust like clay litter
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this litter for a while now. I have multiple cats and they like it. I feel better with it being a natural product made from wheat. And it doesn't seem to create quite as much dust as the clay litter does and yet it's scoop-able like other litter. My order was also delivered promptly.
customer_reviews.author: fjc182

customer_reviews.title: We prefer the single cat variety in the blue bag
customer_reviews.text: But this one has been $4 cheaper, and we are cheap, so we're getting this stuff. I've written a review before--it's good litter for our purposes--but 'm just needing to vent that I really wish they'd sell the single cat variety for the same price.! This stuff in the green bag actually seems to smell worse than the single cat kind, like maybe something more perfume-y.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Almost no Dust But the Paws Do Catch Some Litter
customer_reviews.text: I generally stick with 1 one type of and had been using World's Best, but that was still tracking up dust. Just before I left for the pet store, I received an email about this. It sounded interesting and a little healthier as I suffer from asthma. I got a back to try and I have been hooked ever since. Now I do have two diggers, so I try not to put a lot of litter in one of the pans, but the jump out and tear away, not not the mats I put down. I definitely have found my new go to litter and its great I can have it delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Super Shopper

customer_reviews.title: This litter leaves no smells behind!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t give this 5 stars because it is a little messy. My car tracks the littler everywhere. It’s so light that it gets all over her paws and she leaves a trail of litter everywhere. Plus it leaves a lot of dust. If you prefer the clumping type litters, this one is not quite the same but it does absorb smells really well.
customer_reviews.author: Karina Hilas

customer_reviews.title: Your going to love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I was going through kitty litter on a weekly basis. Getting very expensive. And no matter what I had the smell. I was steered onto this product. But it is costly, is what I thought. But.. Over time I was saving money. It doesn't smell. It's soft on the cats paws and scooping it is a joy. I have found I use less litter and am saving money.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't track through the house
customer_reviews.text: The prodict is a better alternative to regular littler that scatters everywhere. However doesn't always clump to wear it scoopable. Being it's composed of different material I would expect that it not be as great as clumping litter is. So the trade-off is that not all of the contaminated litter get scooped away. But our cat seems to love it much better.
customer_reviews.author: Ali R

customer_reviews.title: It's what my cats use as a bathroom...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I'd toilet trained them.. but... they're cats. So they go in the box. Eco friendly and clumps well. Cheaper on amazon than the pet store. I switched from dusty stinky clay and chemical cat litters when I noticed the dust made me feel ill when dumping it in the cat box. Figured it would affect my cats even worse. Been using this brand over 10 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Lilian

customer_reviews.title: I prefer it over clay, but my cat doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: I like this litter. My cat does not. Pros: Not too dusty. The dust it does have doesn't make me sneeze like the clay litter dust does. Clumps well and handles odors well if you add 1/2-1c baking soda to the litter. Cats themselves are less dusty and need to be bathed less frequently. Cons: tracks easily, gets everywhere. Doesn't clump as well as clay. Must be changed every week or it really stinks, more frequently than that if you don't use baking soda. SUPER EXPENSIVE.
customer_reviews.author: Kimm

customer_reviews.title: Natural, Eco friendly cat litter
customer_reviews.text: I am allergic to most of the cat litters and the dust that comes off them. This cat litter is made from wheat and other grains. It says it is flushable, but I don't feel comfortable putting cat litter into our sewers. It is biodegradable also. It doesn't use perfumes to cover the odor. The wheat enzymes and starches do that naturally.
customer_reviews.author: Judith B. Lay

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love it!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 10 stars, I would. Not only is this environmentally friendly, it's safe around dogs and children because it's wheat. There is no perfume, just keeps things neutral and virtually no dust. I've never had any problems scooping it and my 22 yr old finicky cat is finally doing a much better job of using the litter box as she was preferring to use other places for the past several years, no matter how clean I kept the litter box. I'm in love with this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: This may be an isolated case
customer_reviews.text: This may be an isolated case my cats kicked piles of this onto the carpet and then Peed on it! I’ve never had anything like this happen one of them kept attacking the bag so much so he split it open but this came highly recommended from one of my very good friends so you might want to give it a try it’s more natural
customer_reviews.author: Karen U

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works well could clump better but alot less smell .I'd recommend it if the urine clumped better. Urine clumps tend to stick to the bottom. On the upside it's a natural product ,alot less smell and dust free.
customer_reviews.author: Cori Waters

customer_reviews.title: For places you don't want clay.
customer_reviews.text: I love hate this litter, its used in one of the boxes in a bedroom. It doesn't track super bad, it clumps well. Odor wise, good clay litter lasts longer but I don't want clay dust in my bedroom. It sticks to the box like glue. It still beats Worlds best cat litter for longevity, and doesn't stain like the Walnut litters.
customer_reviews.author: bel

customer_reviews.title: Decent litter
customer_reviews.text: Performs well except for two items that will preclude me from purchasing again. It doesn't absorb very fast so that it has to be fairly deep in the box to prevent it from reaching the bottom, though this is solved by keeping it deep. But the main thing is that it doesn't work very well on the ammonia portion of the odor control. It controls odor except for that, but I don't want a box that smells like a bottle of ammonia.
customer_reviews.author: FJMShopper

customer_reviews.title: large granules, strong clumping, good smell
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many different types of cat litter, and this one seems to be the best of the bunch for me. Worked in the regular litter box, and also clumped very well in the Litter Robot one that rotated. I like that this is made from Wheat. Granuales are a larger size and are easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Yu

customer_reviews.title: Seems to last a lot longer than regular scoopout litter
customer_reviews.text: This litter seems to be more economical than regular types of litter and the remainder in the box retains a cleaner smell. It lasts a lot longer without smelling bad and has clumping which is very easy to clean out. The litter has a natural clean smell to it as well.
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Starheart

customer_reviews.title: Good litter with some advice.
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended getting this kitty litter by a friend who loves it. It does reduce the urine smells, but my cats I guess urinate a lot ( I have check their health) and can over saturated it. My friend also told me to put parchment paper on the bottom of the litter box, because it tends to be harder to clean when the litter hardens. Also one of my dog of my dogs thought wheat litter was great to eat and had a lot of diarrhea. So keep your dogs away.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite litter
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Swheatscoop litter for the past six years, and my cats love it. It clumps great, does not smell, does a good job at hiding any cat smells. It does however get stuck to my kitties paws and they track it all over the house. Doesn't feel great when you step on it with bare feet, so we just have to sweep every couple days.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: We even took in a stray recently (but had to keep him separate until tested and fixed) and my husband said- "get the good stuff-
customer_reviews.text: I would absolutely be a spokesperson for this litter! I have three cats and you would never know with this litter!!! I change it once a month because I feel I should, but never because it smells- which is crazy right?!?! And it's natural? Oh I adore it!! We even took in a stray recently (but had to keep him separate until tested and fixed) and my husband said- "get the good stuff- that other stuff stinks!" (Literally - we got spoiled by Swheat Scoop) Thank you Swheat Scoop for saving me money and more importantly time!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Worked great int he automatic litter box for size, but the odor was horrible - had to switch.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore H Balzer

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Omega Paws litter box and clumps well.
customer_reviews.text: My three cats are pretty easy going and took to this litter on the first day. It slides quickly through the screen on my Omega Paws litter box, which Okocat doesn't, so cleaning the box is much easier and faster. I clumps well, but does tend to stick to the bottom. I keep an old spatula on top of the box to quickly flick the lumps off.
customer_reviews.author: KGinOregon

customer_reviews.title: Great Litter!
customer_reviews.text: My cats (and I) do not like traditional litter. I love the natural smell of this, and it does a great job covering the cat smell, as well. The dust is minimal, and the large granules of litter are easy to clean up when kicked outside of the box. This litter does a good job absorbing urine, making it easy to scoop.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Cat Pee Pancakes
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this so my cats wouldn't be breathing clay dust, but I couldn't stick with it. The cat pee does clump, but it forms what I can only describe as wet pancakes on the bottom of the box which you have to scrape away. The used litter smells waaay worse than any clay I've ever used too. I stuck with it for about two months, but had to go back to clay.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: I just started using this product and absolutely love it! I took some tips from others and scoop the poo/pee clumps, drop them in the toilet and close the lid. In an hour or so, flush it all and there's no smell! I'll give an update in about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Topiary3

customer_reviews.title: More natural, very worth it
customer_reviews.text: We have used this litter for nearly 3 years and love it. It’s gentle and doesn’t have an overbearing scent. I wanted something more natural compared to the most of the litter on the market that is full of chemicals. The only time we ever have a problem with smell is when our cat takes a large poop and doesn’t cover it well but then it goes away after 10-20 minutes or if you wait too long to change the litter. We clean/sift it once a week, and completely change it every 3 weeks or so. & our cat loves it. Other than when it is first being poured, there is no saw dust smell that lingers.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren V.

customer_reviews.title: Love this litter
customer_reviews.text: I love this cat litter. I have been using it for many years and currently have three cats that also love it. It has no chemicals so I don't have to worry about my furry friends breathing anything toxic while going to the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Clumps well, very little dust, no litter smell etc
customer_reviews.text: Love this litter!!! I buy the largest bag as it ends up being cheaper. Doesn't smell like litter, lasts a really long time, almost dust free (if you dont dump from high up), minimal litter tracked out of boxes and clumps really well (as long as you put 4 inches deep in each box and scoop from under the urine/feces which is the proper way). Plus, I buy from Amazon due to free delivery to my front door. Will keep buying!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lj

customer_reviews.title: Low tracking and less mess BUT DOES NOT COVER UP SMELL.
customer_reviews.text: This kitty litter is okay 3/5 stars... it clumps well, and it’s almost impossible for my cats to track this more than 3 inches from their box. Definitely clean the box daily otherwise the litter does get stuck to the bottom of the litter box. My only complaint is that this litter amplifies the urine smell times by a lot if the box isn't cleaned daily.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: Great odor absorbing without chemicals
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! It has a mild pleasant smell reminiscent of town grass. Very odor absorbent, completely absorbs urine odor. One large bag lasts a whole month for 2 cats. Dust free and no tracking chunks around the house. Most importantly, my girls are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: BlueMt.Mama

customer_reviews.title: Best Packaging
customer_reviews.text: I have to use this litter for my asthmatic cats and have struggled trying to get larger sizes to save money. I was buying the single cat litter (seemed cheaper) but it really wasn't. I tried large sizes in the paper bags and had horrible experiences with leakage and bugs. Oddly the multi-cat litter is less expensive overall and the real difference is in the packaging. I buy the 25lb bag and the container is solid with a handle and easy zip opening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This product couldn't be worse. It's dusty, does not control the smell AT ALL and does not clump as well as others! I was fooled by the reviews here into buying this. What a waste of money. I bought another more popular brand instead and I could not believe the difference in odor control! I'm so disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonLoyal

customer_reviews.title: Cats really like it & so do I!
customer_reviews.text: I really appreciate that Swheat Scoop is a natural product without damaging strip mining and dangerous chemicals! Order control is good as long as I scoop it 2-3 times a day. It does get doughie when it gets really wet (I have 3 cats) so I have to stay on my toes as with every cat litter I have ever used! My cats like it better than the walnut or corncob litters. I really like this product and it is the only one I will continue to use! Thank you for such a wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Furmommy Lori

customer_reviews.title: Kitty say they like their kitty litter
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this kitty litter for my cat's for years I presently have three cats and three litter boxes it's a bit expensive but they seem to like it you do get it all over the floor but it absorbs well and there is no smell or just with it other kitty litters have smelling dust
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it...
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this over clay. It isn't dust free at all. So far, I don't notice the dust getting all over the house, on everything. Cat likes it. Cat didn't like another alternative to clay. I'm happy with this. Another plus is; I get my money's worth with Prime and shipping on stuff like this.
customer_reviews.author: rnaple

customer_reviews.title: A natural, biodegradable, clumping litter.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for many months and find it wonderfully natural, odor free, mostly dust free. And much lighter than the clay based litters. Also, if you prefer a lighter bag (this weighs 36 pounds.) try the Smart Cat grass based litter. Basically the same as the wheat based. It comes in a smaller 20 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Rowbear

customer_reviews.title: Flush it down the toilet. no Chemicals!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best stuff ever. If it gets stuck on kitty’s paw I don’t worry since it isn’t some radioactive clay and chemicals that kitty would ingest while cleaning paw, etc. Plus, scoop and flush. This is the END of smelly cat box syndrome. Also excellent when toilet training cat.
customer_reviews.author: T4

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using sWheat Scoop for 3 years now, and it's great! since we flush away the used litter every day, our place never stinks of our cat Potato's pee/droppings. Although it's a little dusty, it's not as dusty as the litter we used to use. Overall this stuff is amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Crotty

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME...with a catch or two.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite litters. It clumps easily and is surprisingly good at controlling smell. HOWEVER, either keep your litter deep (~3") or make sure you're scooping at least twice a day; when the pee clumps harden, they literally turn into cement. Pee wood cement. It's as gross as you might expect.
customer_reviews.author: Dimitri

customer_reviews.title: I love this litter.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for years, I have used all the different version multiple cats, premium etc. but I have not found a great difference between them. The main reason I stay with this brand is the ability to flush the waste in the toilet, I never had an issue with this product clogging the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: kelsyusa

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using original SwheatScoop for several years now, and was never able to multi-cat SwheatScoop until now on Amazon. Love this product! I have a cat with allergic asthma and he has done so much better with this cat litter. It's dust-free, clay-free, good odor control, all natural, and my cats love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have no sense of smell so I’m not going to rate that. I love this litter and my cats do too, I guess. They use it well. Even with litter mats it gets tracked on the floor a little but that’s ok with me. Too expensive!!
customer_reviews.author: Maria J. Arroyave

customer_reviews.title: Controls odor very well
customer_reviews.text: You'd never guess I have a cat in the house; it controls odor that well. A real plus is that it's flushable. It's organic wheat so it doesn't harm the septic/sewer system. As for easy to clean; well, no litter box is easy to clean, but this is better than any others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good clumping cat litter and comes in bulk.
customer_reviews.text: We have two cats and they use the 'box' quite regularly. We've been through too many different types of litter and for some reason they come with their own problems. Wheat Scoop does not carry a heavy scent and really does absorb the urine. It also covers the scent of the poop as well as can be expected. We really like it!
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Legge

customer_reviews.title: Great overall product for standard scooping - not recommended for roll n' clean boxes
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for a couple years now after a friend recommended it. I have two cats and it holds the odors well, clumps easy and is consistently at a pretty good price on amazon. I noticed early on that it doesn't work great with the Omega Roll n' Clean that I was using (it clumped on the bottom and, hence, wasn't 'rolling' out), but since I switched to just a standard box (Booda dome), I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Roxy Edwinson

customer_reviews.title: Flushing cat poop and loving this stuff
customer_reviews.text: The cats love this as it does not stick in their paws as much as other litters we have tried. We get this in our subscribe and save and love not having to go to the store to buy this every month. It clumps the urine and keeps the smell of their poop well. It can be flushed if not on septic.(read exceptions on bag)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low dust- poor clumping.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this looking for a low dust litter. There is relatively low dust, however, this litter does not clump well at all. When trying to scoop out urine clumps they crumble easily- it creates a big mess and very hard to clean up. I will not be buying this again. Makes for a long and frustrating cleaning process-trying to pick up all the tiny crumbles.
customer_reviews.author: Kaley M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesomest cat litter ever.
customer_reviews.text: It's biodegradable. Other cat litters are clay based and just make nasty piles that "clump" forever. This is also flushable. We've done that in the past with it but switched to a Litter Genie since we travel sometimes. 2 male cats and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Ward

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with this product, I liked the pine litter better and just wanted to see if a natural clumping litter would work for us, but it was horrifically stinky with no urine blocking, didn't clump very well and was unimpressed. If anyone wants the rest they can have it.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Natural and flushable! (in some places)
customer_reviews.text: All-time favorite litter! It's made of wheat and doesn't product that chemical dust cloud when pouring it. It's also flushable, depending on what state you live in. Works wells for multiple cats, too. We sprinkle baking soda on top of it in between weekly changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Good, but I like another better.
customer_reviews.text: I originally asked questions about this one before I bought it as I was curious if it would clump better than World's Best. After trying this one out, it was good, but I still like World's Best better and will stick with them. Clumping was not quite as good, and little to no difference otherwise noted, except this one is more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Heather C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Litter Available
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion this is the best cat litter on the market. It clumps decently, isn't dusty, and it doesn't have any perfumes. My cat use it (the most important aspect). My best guess is the litter is pretty environmentally friendly as least compared to clay litters. The only reason it gets 4-stars is the cats track the litter out of the litter box.
customer_reviews.author: Antonia Tallarico

customer_reviews.title: Dusty
customer_reviews.text: It is not just dusty. It is very dusty. If your cat has a sensitive respiratory system it could cause asthma attacks.
customer_reviews.author: William Riley

customer_reviews.title: Dependable, low-dust, and does what it should doo (get it? doo?)
customer_reviews.text: This has been our go-to litter for several years, ever since having a cat with asthma. The litter does get tracked through the house, much as others do... but it is far lower in dust.
customer_reviews.author: GrebeWatcher

customer_reviews.title: Wheat scoop kitty litter. Giant size bag.
customer_reviews.text: Safe, non toxic. Cara the cat has no respitory problems with this and she's 14 yrs. With vets as expensive as people drs. Now it pays to get the best litter. What's a few dollars more when it comes to their health.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie

customer_reviews.title: Best flushable litter!
customer_reviews.text: sWheat Scoop works well, absorbs odors, and is flushable. It’s also unscented, which is nice. The only smell to the litter itself is a slight wheat smell (since that’s what it is), which is not at all unpleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Will Davis

customer_reviews.title: It smells soo bad. I regret this
customer_reviews.text: This kitty litter does zero for odor control. It smells soo bad. I regret this purchase
customer_reviews.author: CMH

customer_reviews.title: I happy I decided to try this litter
customer_reviews.text: It’s seems to be my favorite, sometimes I’ll buy different natural brands and seem to go back to this one. It’s natural and easier to carry than the clay litters. Try it, I think you’ll like it!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Mora

customer_reviews.title: Just so-so
customer_reviews.text: I love this litter... Most of the time. It's great for suppressing odors and it is easy to scoop, so that's a plus. The minus? When I do scoop it, all that trapped smell? Everywhere in my nose. It's still better than most other brands, but because it's natural the ammonia smells of cat urine sometimes still win the day.
customer_reviews.author: d. wilson

customer_reviews.title: No dust to damage your lungs.
customer_reviews.text: Leaves no dust to hurt your lungs or your cats’ lungs. Much better than litter made of clay or gravel. Forms good clumps. More expensive, but my lungs are worth it
customer_reviews.author: alda shelton

customer_reviews.title: I put the box right by the toilet so it is so easy and it doesn't smell and is natural
customer_reviews.text: You can put this stuff right in the toilet so you don't need bags. I put the box right by the toilet so it is so easy and it doesn't smell and is natural. A little expensive so sometimes I buy it here on Prime and sometimes they are out and I foud Chewy.com has a good price if you can get around the shipping. For one time, they waived it. I will come back to Amazon with prime for it. I just hope they don't up the price again.
customer_reviews.author: susan martin

customer_reviews.title: I've been using sWheat scoop for several years now. ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using sWheat scoop for several years now. There is a bit more dust than synthetic, but my boxes are outdoors. I prefer my cats using this than licking chemicals off their paws.
customer_reviews.author: Passat

customer_reviews.title: My Cat loves this sWheat Scoop
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this product. When we get a new bag he rubs up and welcomes it to his area. This product has no artificial scent. It is flushable and easy to use at hotels.
customer_reviews.author: DianaZeus

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for kittens!
customer_reviews.text: This is the litter I prefer when fostering kittens. No dust. They can taste and investigate taste without danger. It cleans well and doesn’t stick or harden between little toes I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: GREAT cat litter with no dust!
customer_reviews.text: Love this litter and believe me, I've tried tons of them. Very little to no dust, which was a big plus for me. It doesn't mask the smell as well as some others with much more dust, so I just add baking soda and that helps. I think it's better than The Worlds Best Cat Litter. I also like the price and I can buy it in big quantities.
customer_reviews.author: Morrie

customer_reviews.title: Best cat litter!
customer_reviews.text: This cat litter delivers just what it says it will -- fast clumping and serious odor control. While I would not say it is 100% track-free, it is much less so than other litter I have used for my cats. It definitely does not stick to their paws the way other litters do so it doesn't get distributed all over the place. I've been using this litter ever since my cats grew out of kitten stage, so for about 3 years now. There are several formulas. I use the fast clumping or the multi-cat versions and I highly recommend either.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne J.

customer_reviews.title: Great product bad mailing  packaging
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product and will probably buy again but the last bag i bought came broken so a lot spilled plus they shipped it with another package n potty got in the bag, not cool, but as the product goes it’s great
customer_reviews.author: andrea

product_meta.title: sWheat Scoop Multi-Cat Litter
product_meta.description: Size:36 lbsWheat Scoop uses natural plant extracts to eliminate odors instead of harmful chemicals. An exclusive Noble Ion Technology infuses wheat enzymes with noble ions to neutralize litter box odors and is extremely effective for odor control. sWheat Scoop has no added dyes, perfumes and is 100% biodegradable. Clumps are fast-forming, firm and compact for easy scooping. sWheat Scoop is better for you, your pet and the environment.
feature_bullets: WHEAT BASED contains no harmful ingredients, naturally neutralizes odors and is a 100% renewable resource
BIODEGRADEABLE + NO DYES/PERFUMES made from renewable resources so everything can go back into the ground
NOBLE ION TECHNOLGY all natural exclusive technolgy which neutralizes odors without masking the smell with artificial fragrances
2X STRONGER CLUMPING AND ODOR ELIMNATION compared to sWheat Scoop Fast-Clumping litter
FLUSHABLE litter has the ability to be flushed

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
